strings.basecampEruMediumImageTwo: The Italian Red Cross works to set up the basecamp in Beira, Mozambique one month after Cyclone Idai hit. 22 April / Beira, Mozambique.
strings.basecampEruMediumImageThree: The Italian Red Cross works to set up the basecamp in Beira, Mozambique one month after Cyclone Idai hit. 22 April 2019 / Beira, Mozambique.
strings.basecampEruMediumImageFour: Earthquake in Haiti 2010, Danish relief ERU team arrives to the Red Cross Headquarters where the basecamp is set up (picture by Jakob Dall).
strings.basecampEruEmergencyListItemOne: Can accommodate 16 - 40 RC delegates, and can be scaled by 4 delegates at the time.
strings.basecampEruEmergencyListItemTwo: Kitchen facilities that can cater for up to 50 delegates, 3 times a day (max 150 meals per day).
strings.basecampEruEmergencyListItemThree: Office facilities for up to 12 delegates.
strings.basecampEruEmergencyListItemFour: Meeting facilities in one 24 meter squared tents.
strings.basecampEruEmergencyListItemFive: Filtration water treatment (EM1000) of up to 10,000 Liter per day.
strings.basecampEruEmergencyListItemSix: Clean water storage capacity 10,000 liters (2 x 5,000L).
strings.designedForDetailsSectionTwo: Areas where infrastructure is damaged, unsafe or missing (earthquakes, floods or population movements).
strings.designedForDetailsSectionThree: Medium and Big operations where keeping delegates together is important for security/coordination.
strings.compositionValue: Team Leader (Assessment), 2-3 Technicians, 1 ITC / Camp Manager, Technician, Kitchen Supervisor.
strings.compositionDescription: In addition to the above team, local staff is normally contracted for maintenance, cleaners, cooks, etc.
strings.specificationsVariationOnConfigurationTe: Camp can be scaled up or down depending on the situation, within all the modules.
